intro: Seseli libanotis var. sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are white or pale blue, with five petals, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. It is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
